instructions: Start in plank position with hands slightly wider than shoulder-width
Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels
Lower your body until chest nearly touches the floor
Push back up to starting position
Keep core engaged throughout the movement
tips: Keep your elbows at a 45-degree angle to your body
Don't let your hips sag or pike up
Breathe out as you push up, breathe in as you lower down
Start with knees on floor if full push-ups are too difficult
common_mistakes: Flaring elbows out too wide (can cause shoulder pain)
Not going low enough (chest should nearly touch floor)
Arching or sagging the back (keep core tight)

instructions: Place hands on elevated surface (bench, table, or wall)
Position hands slightly wider than shoulder-width
Keep body in straight line from head to heels
Push back up to starting position
Keep body straight from head to heels
Lower body until chest nearly touches floor
Push back up to starting position
tips: Don't go too wide (can strain shoulders)
common_mistakes: Hands too wide (can cause shoulder pain)

instructions: Place feet on elevated surface (bench or step)
Hands on floor, slightly wider than shoulder-width
Lie on bench with dumbbells at shoulder level
Palms facing forward, elbows at 90 degrees
Press dumbbells straight up until arms extended
Lower with control back to shoulders
Lie on bench with dumbbells extended above chest
Slight bend in elbows (don't lock out)
Lower dumbbells in wide arc until chest stretch
Bring dumbbells back together above chest
tips: Keep slight bend in elbows throughout
Focus on chest stretch and contraction

instructions: Set cable pulleys at shoulder height
Start with arms extended to sides
Bring handles together in front of chest
Squeeze chest, then return with control
Lie on bench with feet flat on floor
Grip bar slightly wider than shoulder-width
Unrack bar and hold directly over chest
Lower bar to chest with control (2-3 seconds)
Press bar up explosively until arms are fully extended
Rack the bar safely when finished
tips: Keep shoulder blades retracted and pressed into bench
Maintain slight arch in lower back (not excessive)
Keep wrists straight and aligned with forearms
Use a spotter when lifting heavy weights
Control the descent - don't bounce the bar off your chest
common_mistakes: Flaring elbows too wide (keep at 45-60 degrees)
Bouncing bar off chest (can cause injury)
Not using full range of motion

instructions: Find a sturdy horizontal bar or table at waist height
Lie underneath it and grab the bar with overhand grip
Keep your body straight from head to heels
Pull your chest up to the bar by squeezing your shoulder blades
Lower yourself with control back to starting position
tips: Keep your core engaged throughout the movement
Focus on pulling with your back muscles, not just arms
Keep your elbows close to your body
Go as high as you can - aim to touch your chest to the bar
common_mistakes: Arching your back too much (keep body straight)
Using only your arms (engage your back muscles)
Not going full range of motion

instructions: Hold handles, step back to create tension
Pull handles to chest, squeezing shoulder blades
tips: Focus on back muscles, not just arms

instructions: Lie face down on the floor with arms extended in front
Keep your legs straight and together
Lift your chest and legs off the ground simultaneously
tips: Focus on lifting from your lower back, not just arching
Keep your neck in a neutral position (don't crane it up)
Start with shorter holds and build up
common_mistakes: Lifting too high (moderate lift is more effective)

instructions: Stand with slight bend in knees, lean forward
Raise arms out to sides until parallel to floor
tips: Focus on rear delts and upper back

instructions: Hang from bar with palms facing away (overhand grip)
Engage your lats and pull your body up
Pull until chin clears the bar
Lower yourself with control to full arm extension
tips: Start from a dead hang (full arm extension)
Focus on pulling with your back, not just arms
Use resistance bands for assistance if needed
common_mistakes: Not going to full extension at bottom
Pulling with arms only (should engage lats first)

instructions: Hang from bar with palms facing toward you (underhand grip)
Hands shoulder-width apart or slightly narrower
Engage your back and biceps to pull your body up
Pull until chin clears the bar
Lower yourself with control to full arm extension
tips: Underhand grip targets biceps more than pull-ups
Control the descent - don't drop down
Use resistance bands for assistance if needed
common_mistakes: Not going to full extension at bottom

instructions: Pull bar down to upper chest
Control the return to starting position
tips: Focus on pulling with back, not arms

instructions: Stand with feet hip-width, slight knee bend
Hinge at hips, grip bar shoulder-width
Pull bar to lower chest/upper abdomen
tips: Pull with back muscles, not just arms
common_mistakes: Pulling too high (should be to lower chest)

instructions: Bend elbows, lower head toward floor
Push back up to starting position
Keep legs as straight as possible
Keep core tight and body stable
Lift one hand, tap opposite shoulder
Sit or stand with dumbbells at shoulder height
Palms facing forward, elbows slightly in front
Press dumbbells straight up until arms are fully extended
Keep your core engaged and back straight
Lower dumbbells with control back to shoulders
tips: Keep your core tight to protect your lower back
Control the weight on the way down
common_mistakes: Arching back too much (can cause injury)
Pressing forward instead of straight up

instructions: Raise arms out to sides until parallel to floor
Stand with feet shoulder-width, core engaged
Keep core tight, don't arch back excessively
Lower with control back to shoulders
Grab rope attachment with both hands
Pull rope toward face, separating hands
Squeeze rear delts and upper back
common_mistakes: Pulling too low or too high

instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, toes slightly turned out
Keep chest up and core engaged
Lower down by pushing hips back and bending knees
Descend until thighs are parallel to floor (or as low as comfortable)
Drive through heels to return to standing position
Keep knees tracking over toes throughout movement
tips: Keep your weight on your heels, not toes
Maintain a neutral spine (don't round your back)
Go as deep as your mobility allows
Keep your knees from caving inward
Breathe in on the way down, out on the way up
common_mistakes: Knees caving inward (keep them aligned with toes)
Leaning too far forward (keep chest up)
Not going deep enough (aim for parallel at minimum)
Rising onto toes (keep weight on heels)

instructions: Step forward with one leg, lowering your hips
Keep your front knee over your ankle, not past your toes
Push through your front heel to return to starting position
Alternate legs or complete all reps on one side
tips: Don't let your front knee cave inward
Keep your back knee just above the ground
Step far enough forward to create a 90-degree angle
common_mistakes: Stepping too short (knee goes past toes)
Leaning forward too much (keep torso upright)
Back knee touching the ground (keep it slightly elevated)
Knee caving inward (keep aligned with toes)

instructions: Lie on back, knees bent, feet flat
Lift hips up by squeezing glutes
Form straight line from knees to shoulders
Stand in front of bench or step
Push through heel to step up
Bring other foot up to bench
Step down with control, alternate legs
tips: Push through heel of working leg
common_mistakes: Pushing off back leg (should be front leg)
Step too high (can cause knee issues)

instructions: Hold dumbbell or kettlebell at chest
Lower down by pushing hips back
Place back foot on bench or elevated surface
Front foot forward, knee over ankle
Lower down until front thigh parallel
Drive through front heel to stand
Complete all reps on one side, then switch
tips: Great for leg strength and balance

instructions: Push through heels to extend legs
Place bar on upper back (not neck)
Lower by pushing hips back and bending knees
Sit on edge of bench, hands gripping edge
Push back up to starting position
common_mistakes: Going too low (can cause shoulder pain)

instructions: Sit or stand, hold dumbbell overhead
Lower dumbbell behind head by bending elbows
Stand at cable machine, grab bar attachment
Elbows at sides, bent at 90 degrees
Push bar down until arms extended
Lie on bench, grip bar close (hands 6-8 inches apart)
tips: Hands closer than regular bench press

instructions: Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat on floor
Place hands behind your head (don't pull on neck)
Engage your core and lift your shoulders off the ground
Curl your upper body toward your knees
tips: Don't pull on your neck with your hands
Focus on lifting with your abs, not momentum
Keep your lower back on the ground
Exhale as you crunch up, inhale as you lower
common_mistakes: Coming up too high (small range is fine)
Lifting lower back off ground (keep it down)

instructions: Lie flat on your back with legs straight
Place hands under your lower back for support
Keep your lower back pressed to the floor
Lift your legs straight up until perpendicular to floor
Lower your legs slowly with control
Stop before your lower back lifts off the floor
tips: Lower slowly - control is more important than speed
Don't let your lower back arch off the floor
If too difficult, bend knees slightly or raise less high
common_mistakes: Arching lower back (keep it pressed to floor)
Going too fast (slow and controlled is better)
Not engaging core (should feel it in your abs)

instructions: Sit on floor, knees bent, lean back slightly
tips: Can lift feet for more challenge

instructions: Engage core and lift knees toward chest
Kneel in front of cable machine
Grab rope attachment, bring to head
Curl down, bringing elbows toward knees
tips: Focus on abs, not hip flexors
common_mistakes: Using hip flexors instead of abs

instructions: Lie on bench, grab behind head
Lift entire body up using core
Start in push-up position on forearms
Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels
Hold the position for desired time
tips: Don't let your hips sag or pike up
Keep your neck in neutral position
Focus on engaging your core, not just holding position
Start with shorter holds (20-30 seconds) and build up

instructions: Lie on side, prop up on forearm
Form straight line from head to feet
Lie on back, hands behind head
Alternate bringing elbow to opposite knee
Lie on back, arms extended up
tips: Keep lower back pressed to floor

instructions: Lie on back, arms extended overhead
Lift shoulders and legs off ground
Keep lower back pressed to floor
Place hands together forming diamond shape
Lower body, elbows close to body
tips: Can do on knees to start

instructions: Lower on that side while other arm extends
Push back up, shift to other side
Lie back, dumbbells at shoulder level
Press dumbbells up and slightly forward
Lie back, dumbbells at lower chest
Keep body straight from head to heels
Pull up until chin clears bar
Grip bar close (hands together or narrow)
Pull up, focusing on biceps and back
Place one knee and hand on bench

tips: Can use more weight than dumbbells

instructions: Pull handle to lower chest/upper abdomen
Lie face down on floor or bench
Curl weights up by bending elbows
Stand with dumbbells, palms facing in

tips: Focus on one arm at a time

instructions: Curl bar up by bending elbows
tips: Can use more weight than dumbbells

instructions: Hang from bar with underhand grip
Pull up until chin over bar
Stand with slight bend, lean forward
Start with dumbbells at shoulders, palms facing you
Kick up to handstand against wall
Kick up to handstand against wall

tips: Focus on one leg at a time

instructions: Slide down until thighs parallel to floor
Hinge at hips, slight knee bend
Return to standing by squeezing glutes
Hinge at hips, slight knee bend
tips: Can use more weight than dumbbells

instructions: Push through front heel to step forward
Push through front heel to return
tips: Easier on knees than forward lunges

instructions: Step to side, lower into lunge
Stand with feet wide, toes turned out
Lower down by pushing hips back
Stand with feet hip-width, bar over mid-foot
Grab parallel bars or dip bars
Push back up to starting position
common_mistakes: Going too low (can cause shoulder pain)

instructions: Sit on edge of chair, hands gripping edge
Start in plank, hands in diamond shape
Lower body, elbows close to body
Lie on bench, hold barbell/EZ bar
Push down, separating hands at bottom
